ingredients: 8 ounces baby bella mushrooms, trimmed and sliced (about 2-3 cups)
steps: In a large sauté pan, heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Using a wooden spoon:
> Add the onion and sauté until tender, about 6 minutes
> Add the mushrooms and sauté until they have given up their liquid and it has mostly evaporated, 5-10 minutes
> If using, add the peas to defrost (1-2 min)
> Add the spinach and sauté until wilted, 1-2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside
In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, garlic powder, salt, and pepper
> Stir in the the Swiss cheese and the spinach/mushroom mixture
> Pour the mix into the unbaked pie shell and any extra can go in a small glass tupperware or baking dish
Bake until the quiche is lightly golden and set in the center when the pan is gently pushed, about 45 minutes
> If the crust is browning too quickly, cover it with foil to prevent it from burning
> Note: if the crust if frozen, no additional baking time is necessary
title: Mushroom, Spinach, & Swiss Cheese Quiche
